messages.message:
When you have a long document and you scroll, the scroll bar jump around a lot. It looks like we’re not setting the placeholder div when a page is loading to the same size as the loaded page, resulting in the size of the whole document changing additional pages load

https://www.loom.com/share/335cba8a33454262aec6d3824c8276de

This is true for flow review and any apps that use our docWidget. The reason for this is we load documents as the user needs to see them to increase performance hence why the scrollbar is changing. If we didn't do this, performance would take a hit rendering all the pages at the same time.

Hey is there a way of doing that while also knowing what the fully loaded document length will be before its fully loaded? Totally understand the lazy loading, but if a file has 100 pages in it, can we not make the div the size of 100 pages and then still load the images when scrolling to that point?
the size of each page may not be consistent, so we don’t know what the height of the 100 pages will be until we load each page
